content:
• Tuesday, July 2, 2013

  • WTI crude oil (USO) gains another 2.2% in overnight trade, now fetching $101.80 per barrel,...

    WTI crude oil (USO) gains another 2.2% in overnight trade, now fetching $101.80 per barrel, the highest level in about 15 months amid political turmoil in Egypt. The situation may be bad enough to threaten the region's oil supplies, but the Egyptian stock market rose 4.9% today suggesting some measure of hope. The Egypt Index ETF (EGPT) gained 5.8% in New York trade. S&P 500 futures -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 PM | 7 Comments
  • GROW

    U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) announces its CFO, Catherine Rademacher, has resigned. The...

    U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) announces its CFO, Catherine Rademacher, has resigned. The firm promotes its Controller, Lisa Callicotte to replace her. Ms. Rademacher will be leaving the company effective July 12, 2013 to take a position as a controller with a local credit union. Shares +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • LNCOQ

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LNCO +7%. EMCI +2%. OSK +2%. GTIV +2%. TOWR +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LNCO +7%. EMCI +2%. OSK +2%. GTIV +2%. TOWR +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ENTR -6%. SPPI -3%. AVNR -2%. PCAR -2%. ANV -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 8 Comments
  • UNTK

    UniTek Global Services (NASDAQ:UNTK) says it's received a commitment letter from Apollo...

    UniTek Global Services (NASDAQ:UNTK) says it's received a commitment letter from Apollo Investment for financing arrangements including an asset-based revolving credit facility totaling $75M. Shares +12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • STNG

    Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG) reaches agreements with two yards in Korea to construct a minimum of...

    Scorpio Tankers (NYSE:STNG) reaches agreements with two yards in Korea to construct a minimum of five and up to 10 newbuilding vessels designed to carry liquefied petroleum gas. Also, STNG takes delivery of its ninth newbuilding MR product tanker, agrees to time charter-in a 2013-built LR2 product tanker, and declares options on two existing time chartered-in vessels. STNG +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • UNIS

    Unilife (UNIS +5.2%) spiked higher into the close of trading again today on no news-specific...

    Unilife (UNIS +5.2%) spiked higher into the close of trading again today on no news-specific driver. The stock has now risen over 15% in just the last three sessions in a news vacuum.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +2.3%) trades up after saying its Medicis division has inked a...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +2.3%) trades up after saying its Medicis division has inked a collaboration deal with breast aesthetics company Mentor Worldwide to enter certain of their non-reimbursed products into a combined physician loyalty program. The new program, called the Medicis-Mentor Valued Partner program, extends current offerings of Medicis' recently-launched MVP program to include the Mentor line of breast implant products for a five-year term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • X

    U.S. Steel (X +6.4%) and Tenaris (TS +5.6%) are seeing late bids on rumors of a favorable ruling...

    U.S. Steel (X +6.4%) and Tenaris (TS +5.6%) are seeing late bids on rumors of a favorable ruling in an anti-dumping case (Briefing.com), but there's no news yet.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • ARTX

    Arotech (ARTX +4%) pops today after saying it's received a number of orders for batteries...

    Arotech (ARTX +4%) pops today after saying it's received a number of orders for batteries totaling $5M. The orders come from a mix of military and commercial customers, including $2.25M for the division's water-activated survivor locator lights.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • BBEPQ

    Caught up in the Linn/LinnCo downdraft is BreitBurn Energy Partners (BBEP -8.2%), which Hedgeye...

    Caught up in the Linn/LinnCo downdraft is BreitBurn Energy Partners (BBEP -8.2%), which Hedgeye slammed this morning as "Linn Energy junior" whose fair value is $2-$8/unit and whose distribution is "largely a mirage." EV Energy Partners (EVEP-OLD -0.7%) and QR Energy (QRE -3.2%) also are mentioned as companies that "may significantly understate maintenance capex, and as a result, overstate DCF."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 15 Comments
  • NDLS

    Noodles & Company (NDLS +21.3%) soars yet again as Jim Cramer says he loves "regional to...

    Noodles & Company (NDLS +21.3%) soars yet again as Jim Cramer says he loves "regional to national stories" and praises the company for "cornering the noodle market." Cramer also says the market might have "learned its lesson" after the success of Chuy's and Bloomin' Brands. Put simply: "We're in a terrific bull market for regional to national restaurant chains," Cramer concludes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • OMER

    Omeros (OMER +6.4%) moves up after saying earlier that the European Medicines Agency has...

    Omeros (OMER +6.4%) moves up after saying earlier that the European Medicines Agency has approved a positive opinion issued by the European Pediatrics Committee agreeing to the company's Pediatric Investigation Plan for OMS302. The drug is an anti-inflammatory agent and an agent that causes pupil dilation for use during ophthalmological procedures, including cataract and other lens replacement surgery.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • CVRR

    U.S. crude oil futures (USO, UCO) settle near $100/bbl as supply concerns due to geopolitical...

    U.S. crude oil futures (USO, UCO) settle near $100/bbl as supply concerns due to geopolitical turmoil override fears about the global economy. Brent crude moves past $103, but the spread over WTI continues to narrow. Refiners continue to get slammed: CVRR -5.2%, ALJ -3.9%, PSX -3.4%, CVI -3.3%, WNR -3%, TSO -3%, CLMT -2.5%, VLO -2.4%, MPC -2.2%, DK -2.1%, NTI -2%, HFC -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 12 Comments
  • ZEP

    Zep Inc. (ZEP -17.2%) craters after FQ3 earnings and revenue miss estimates. CEO John Morgan...

    Zep Inc. (ZEP -17.2%) craters after FQ3 earnings and revenue miss estimates. CEO John Morgan calls the EPS miss "very disappointing" and notes that while ZEP's "long-term diversification strategy is working," organic revenue declines will likely "continue over the next twelve months while [the company] accelerates [its] focus on business complexity reduction." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • TXTR

    Underwriter coverage day is proving kind to Textura (TXTR +8.8%), which is making new post-IPO...

    Underwriter coverage day is proving kind to Textura (TXTR +8.8%), which is making new post-IPO highs after Oppenheimer, William Blair, Credit Suisse, and Barrington Research all rate the provider of cloud-based construction industry software an Outperform. Oppenheimer declares Textura's software to be "disrupting the collaboration-intensive commercial construction market" by replacing spreadsheets and on-premise apps, and thinks its addressable market (estimated value of ~$1.2B) should triple over the next few years, given it's "on the cusp of a major expansion cycle after a lengthy downturn." Shares are up 99% from their June 7 IPO price of $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ACHN

    "We see the clinical hold as mainly a drug-drug interaction issue rather than a safety concern,"...

    "We see the clinical hold as mainly a drug-drug interaction issue rather than a safety concern," Leerink's Howard Liang says, regarding the clinical hold on sovaprevir (previous) that has shares of Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN -25.2%) reeling. SA contributor PropThink is inclined to agree, calling the negativity "overdone" and noting that the ongoing Phase II trial of sovaprevir and ACH-3102 — which Liang calls "the more important asset in the portfolio" — has not been halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • MJN

    Shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -6.1%) responds to reports that it, as well as other...

    Shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -6.1%) responds to reports that it, as well as other companies, are under investigation in China for possible antitrust violations. The company says it's committed to providing high-quality and safe products at a good value for consumers in China and throughout the world, and it's fully cooperating with the Chinese government antitrust review of resale prices in the infant formula market and will provide information in response to inquiries received from government officials.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • CREE

    Checks indicate Cree's (CREE +3.1%) LED bulb sales are better than expected, says Goldman, which...

    Checks indicate Cree's (CREE +3.1%) LED bulb sales are better than expected, says Goldman, which is now incrementally more positive on the company's consumer leverage. Cree, which recently began selling (relatively) cheap LED bulbs via Home Depot, made new 52-week highs this morning before pulling back a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE -18.5%) and LinnCo (LNCO -16.9%) slump to session lows in the wake of the...

    Linn Energy (LINE -18.5%) and LinnCo (LNCO -16.9%) slump to session lows in the wake of the informal SEC inquiry and subsequent J.P. Morgan downgrade. Also issuing a downgrade, Wells Fargo believes the Linn structure, in and of itself, is not under scrutiny, but says investors may discount the possibility that the Berry (NASDAQ:BRY) merger unravels given the inquiry which could take one to four months to complete.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 23 Comments
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (AYI +6.5%) trades up today after its FQ2 beat across the board. The company...

    Acuity Brands (AYI +6.5%) trades up today after its FQ2 beat across the board. The company posted an 11% increase in sales, but net earnings fell 5.7% however, primarily due to inventory streamlining and other charges. Gross margin also narrowed to 40.8% from 41.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -5.2%) dives below $10 as investors continue jumping ship in response to the...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -5.2%) dives below $10 as investors continue jumping ship in response to the company's FQ1 miss and related hardware/services shortfalls. Shares are now down 33% from Thursday's close. TD Securities (Hold) defends BlackBerry a bit, noting Asia-Pac subs grew 29% Y/Y in FQ1 even as total subs fell by 4M Q/Q, and declaring it "seems early to sound the death knell of BB10 five months in and with the Q5 yet to launch." (downgrades: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 96 Comments
  • CLDX

    Shares of Celldex (CLDX +11.1%) post double-digit gains on the session. Monday evening, the...

    Shares of Celldex (CLDX +11.1%) post double-digit gains on the session. Monday evening, the company announced the dosing of the first dense deposit disease patient in a pilot study of CDX-1135 which the company hopes can "restore kidney function and provide long term disease control." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • WBMD

    WebMD Health (WBMD -9.5%) is taking a big hit today on unconfirmed reports of a negative piece...

    WebMD Health (WBMD -9.5%) is taking a big hit today on unconfirmed reports of a negative piece from boutique research firm OffWallStreet. In addition to the negative research report, it's been disclosed that a number of key executives surrendered shares to satisfy the minimum tax withholding requirement arising from a recent vesting.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile (NQ +6.2%) jumps after SA contributor Steven Weitz declares the mobile security...

    NQ Mobile (NQ +6.2%) jumps after SA contributor Steven Weitz declares the mobile security software vendor to be "in the sweet spot of the mobile Internet tsunami," and attractively priced at 3.9x trailing sales and 2.2x forward sales. Weitz highlights NQ's 56% Chinese mobile security share, its favorable Google Play and security test reviews, and its efforts to diversify into mobile gaming/social networking (Feiliu) and enterprise mobile services (NationSky).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • DVA

    Deutsche Bank comments on the impact to DaVita (DVA -4.9%) of CMS' 2014 Medicare ESRD proposed...

    Deutsche Bank comments on the impact to DaVita (DVA -4.9%) of CMS' 2014 Medicare ESRD proposed rule - which reduces dialysis rates by 9.4% - saying the figure is twice as high as expected. Deutsche doesn't plan to make any changes to DVA's model at present, as it expects CMS to make adjustments in a final rule, but the changes would have to improve significantly for for the firm to remain confident in 2014 estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • RKUS

    Ruckus (RKUS +8.6%) is skying higher following Piper's bullish coverage launch. Analyst Gus...

    Ruckus (RKUS +8.6%) is skying higher following Piper's bullish coverage launch. Analyst Gus Richard predicts 2/3 of mobile data traffic will be offloaded onto Wi-Fi and small cell networks by 2017, up from ~1/3 in 2012, and observes the new Hotspot 2.0 standard will allow consumers to seamlessly connect to carrier Wi-Fi networks. He also reports Ruckus' SmartCell Gateway controller (believed to carry high margins) is "in production at several operators," that pushed-out Chinese orders will return, and that new carrier deal announcements will act as catalysts. Richard's commentary also has implications for rival Aruba (ARUN +1.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • SEII

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLNT +25%. MTSL +16%. SGOC +13%. CLFD +13%. LPTH +12%. NOAH +12%. TXTR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLNT +25%. MTSL +16%. SGOC +13%. CLFD +13%. LPTH +12%. NOAH +12%. TXTR +10%. PTEK +10%. NYNY +9%. ZNGA +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ACHN -24%. HDSN -24%. ZEP -16%. LINE -15%. SINO -13%. LNCO -12%. PBMD -12%. UQM -12%. RBY -11%. WBMD -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE -14.4%) and LinnCo (LNCO -12.2%) are downgraded by at least three firms...

    Linn Energy (LINE -14.4%) and LinnCo (LNCO -12.2%) are downgraded by at least three firms following the disclosure of the informal SEC inquiry. J.P. Morgan expects significant volatility in LINE until the SEC inquiry is resolved and the impact on the Berry (BRY -5.2%) transaction is known. Howard Weil thinks the SEC could wind up forcing LINN to restate non-GAAP discretionary cash flow (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 18 Comments
  • GRPN

    More on Wunderlich's bullish Groupon (GRPN +4.4%) coverage launch: The firm views Groupon "as a...

    More on Wunderlich's bullish Groupon (GRPN +4.4%) coverage launch: The firm views Groupon "as a marketing company for local businesses that has been transitioning away from the daily deals business model," and argues its transition to "offering a deal bank of discounted goods and services to browse" ultimately makes it more valuable to customers and sellers. The arguments resemble those in Deutsche's June "Groupon 2.0" upgrade. Shares now +86% YTD, but still well below their $20 Nov. '11 IPO price.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • IDT

    IDT (IDT -2.5%) slides after SA contributor Richard Pearson argues the long-distance phone...

    IDT (IDT -2.5%) slides after SA contributor Richard Pearson argues the long-distance phone service provider's problems go well beyond the long-term threat posed by VoIP services. Pearson asserts CEO Howard Jonas (controls 74% of voting rights) has cost IDT $1B+ by investing in ventures such as hedge funds, Israeli shale oil, comic books, and Hispanic food delivery, and sees the company's latest venture (spectrum owner/IP litigation firm Spectrum Communications) also failing. He also notes IDT's $140M cash balance is offset by $270M in liabilities, and that its earnings have been propped up by one-time gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • LCAV

    LCA-Vision (LCAV -2.9%) says that LasikPlus procedures declined 9.9% in Q1 Y/Y, citing new...

    LCA-Vision (LCAV -2.9%) says that LasikPlus procedures declined 9.9% in Q1 Y/Y, citing new limits to tax-saving flexible spending accounts that caused some patients to put off the elective surgery. 12,994 procedures were performed in Q2, down from 14,415 last year and below the 16,272 performed during Q1. The maximum contribution for flexible spending accounts was lowered this year to $2,500 from $5K, and the company expects the contribution limit to have a comparable percentage impact on procedure volume throughout the current year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • RPRX

    "Androxal presents several potential advantages including oral dosing, fewer side effects, and...

    "Androxal presents several potential advantages including oral dosing, fewer side effects, and preservation of fertility," Bank of America says, initiating Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +3.3%) at Buy with a $25 price target. Analyst Steve Byrne sees peak 2022 sales of $450M for the low testosterone treatment, although there are potential risk factors including "a remaining phase 3 read-out" and the company's lack of "commercialization experience."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • TI

    Disagreements over price have led Telecom Italia's (TI -2.6%) mobile M&A talks with...

    Disagreements over price have led Telecom Italia's (TI -2.6%) mobile M&A talks with Hutchison Whampoa to stall, 4 sources tell Bloomberg; Reuters had reported of postponed talks and a lack of deal momentum a month ago. Two of Bloomberg's sources add TI's board will likely decide to end the talks this week to focus on the telco's wireline spinoff. That could please major TI shareholder Telefonica (NYSE:TEF), which reportedly has been wary of a merger, partly given the deal's price would imply a lower valuation for Telefonica's stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +5.4%) pick up steam after some insider buying and...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +5.4%) pick up steam after some insider buying and reports of strong traffic in European stores helps to lift sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • FOE

    Shares of Ferro (FOE -9.4%) slip as Bloomberg reports that A. Schulman's (SHLM -6.5%) CEO Joe...

    Shares of Ferro (FOE -9.4%) slip as Bloomberg reports that A. Schulman's (SHLM -6.5%) CEO Joe Gingo says the company is no-longer pursuing a takeover of the company, nor is it responding to any takeover bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • HUN

    Chemical producer Huntsman (HUN -3.6%) is considering a bid for Rockwood Holdings' (ROC +2%)...

    Chemical producer Huntsman (HUN -3.6%) is considering a bid for Rockwood Holdings' (ROC +2%) Sachtleben titanium-oxide pigments business, Bloomberg reports. HUN officials are said to have traveled to Germany to conduct due diligence and assess synergies. A deal could ease ROC's thus far unsuccessful attempt to sell its performance additives business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.5%) trades weaker with a warning out from OTR Global...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.5%) trades weaker with a warning out from OTR Global that the company is losing market share to private-label brands.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ +3.3%) rallies for the second time in two weeks in response to news a fellow enterprise...

    OCZ (OCZ +3.3%) rallies for the second time in two weeks in response to news a fellow enterprise SSD vendor is being acquired. Last week, the trigger was Western Digital's purchase of sTec. Today, it's SanDisk's purchase of SMART Storage. Though OCZ sells enterprise drives, the company is more dependent on consumer SSD sales than either of the acquisition targets. Fusion-io (FIO -2.1%), which joined OCZ in rallying last time around, is selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 5 Comments
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +1.8%) says it has spudded the first well on its Stalder pad in Ohio. The pad...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +1.8%) says it has spudded the first well on its Stalder pad in Ohio. The pad has been designed and permitted to drill as many as 18 wells, 10 to the Marcellus shale and eight to the Utica shale, using MHR’s new Schramm T500XD robotic drilling rig. The first well will test the Marcellus and the second the Utica.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold's (ABX -3%) $4.5B-$5.5B charge on the Pascua-Lama project might be only the first...

    Barrick Gold's (ABX -3%) $4.5B-$5.5B charge on the Pascua-Lama project might be only the first of nearly $10B in writedowns, TD Securities says, pointing to the copper segment, where ABX still carries $3.5B of goodwill related to its disastrous acquisition of Equinox Minerals in 2011, and the Buzwagi mine in Tanzania, which has a $747M book value and is vulnerable to weaker gold prices and high operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • RVLT

    LED bulb/signage maker Revolution Lighting (RVLT -2.5%) falls after TheStreetSweeper takes aim....

    LED bulb/signage maker Revolution Lighting (RVLT -2.5%) falls after TheStreetSweeper takes aim. The site warns Revolution "may run out of cash as early as this month" and foresees additional dilution, questions the wisdom of buying commercial LED lighting provider SeeSmart for $20M (losses, declining sales, and related party transactions are cited), and argues RVLT has a weak IP position and is facing strong competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +10.3%) is matching yesterday's gains as investors give a thumbs-up to the hiring of...

    Zynga (ZNGA +10.3%) is matching yesterday's gains as investors give a thumbs-up to the hiring of Don Mattrick as CEO. Jim Cramer: "[$1.6B] in cash for a [$2.4B] market cap with a new ceo - that seems pretty hopeful. I am mindful about how well GRPN did after sacking Mason." The WSJ reports ~95% of Mattrick's compensation will be in stock. Fast Company reports Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) pending reorg and the fact Mattrick "would not be getting a bigger role" spurred his departure. It also points out Mattrick was "the force behind The Sims" at Electronic Arts, and championed the Kinect at Microsoft. A Microsoft exec: "Don has this really ambitious vision ... Then he’s just relentless, dogged about pushing people beyond their comfort zones."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (FXEN +2.4%) says it has started field acquisition on a 3D seismic in the area of its...

    FX Energy (FXEN +2.4%) says it has started field acquisition on a 3D seismic in the area of its Tuchola-3K gas well in Poland to delineate the extent of the structure and help quantify reserves. The success of Tuchola-3K "raises the real possibility of opening a significant new exploration play for us," CEO David Pierce says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -1.4%) slips this morning on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation at Piper...

    Illumina (ILMN -1.4%) slips this morning on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation at Piper Jaffray. The firm also lowered its price target to $70 from $72 a share, which, based on the chart appears to be in the a conservative call in the mid-range of where its been trading since early March.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • AM-OLD

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +4.6%) pops as the Weiss family raises its bid for the company to...

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +4.6%) pops as the Weiss family raises its bid for the company to $19/share after a major shareholder - TowerView LLC (run by Daniel Tisch) - said it would oppose the earlier offer of $18.20. TowerView has no comment on the raised price. Kudos to SA Pro's Whopper Investments for spotting another takeover bid as likely to be raised (OUTD was the other).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • GM

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) June U.S. sales: +6.0% to 264,843, to more than triple the estimate of...

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) June U.S. sales: +6.0% to 264,843, to more than triple the estimate of analysts forecasting a 1.3% gain. Segment sales results include crossovers up 9%, trucks/vans/SUVs 8% higher, and car sales gaining 4%. Cadillac sales rose 38% with the new ATS and XTS contributing - while the Chevrolet Cruze set an all-time monthly sales record. Shares of GM +2.6% off the surprising strength in June sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 6 Comments
  • YELP

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Pac Crest has started coverage on Yelp (YELP...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Pac Crest has started coverage on Yelp (YELP +2.9%) with an Outperform. 2) Wunderlich has started coverage on Groupon (GRPN +2.8%) with a Buy. 3) Barclays has upgraded Seagate (STX +0.4%) to Equalweight. 4) Morgan Stanley has launched coverage on Avago (AVGO +1.6%) with an Overweight. 5) Argus has downgraded Accenture (ACN -0.1%) to Hold (previous). 6) LightintheBox (LITB +0.5%) has been started at Outperform by Oppenheimer and Pac Crest, and at Hold by Stifel (underwriter coverage day).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • ROAN

    Berry Petroleum (BRY -8.8%) could hit $35/share if its Linn Energy (LINE -14.1%) merger doesn't...

    Berry Petroleum (BRY -8.8%) could hit $35/share if its Linn Energy (LINE -14.1%) merger doesn't go through, which could come about if the SEC makes its inquiry formal or if shareholders don't approve the deal, Sterne Agee's Tim Rezvan believes. In a best-case scenario, BRY could see ~15% more upside if its merger closes within the quarter, implying a takeover price of ~$48.71. LNCO -12.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 4 Comments

  • Market preview: Stock futures are flat after being higher earlier as markets drift a bit ahead...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat after being higher earlier as markets drift a bit ahead of the the day off on Thursday and the jobs report on Friday, with the S&P Mini -0.02%. Zynga surges 11.7% on news of a changing of the guard at the top and Onyx is +2% as the buyout speculation continues, while Constellation Brands is -1.45% following earnings. Later: Factory Orders, Fed Speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) -4.1% after warning it expects Q2 revenue to be flat Q/Q compared...

    Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) -4.1% after warning it expects Q2 revenue to be flat Q/Q compared with Q1's $57.4M, below prior guidance of a 5%-10% increase (which itself was well below consensus when issued) and a consensus of $61.4M. Gross margin, however, is expected to be in the 47%-49% range, above prior guidance of 45%-47%. The chipmaker chalks up the revenue shortfall to tight NAND flash supply, which lead to lower-than-expected sales of memory card and USB flash drive controllers. Embedded NAND controller sales beat expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • SEII

    Premarket gainers: CLNT +35%. ZNGA +10%.Losers: HDSN -32%. ACHN -20%. LINE -11%. LNCO -10%. FMS...

    Premarket gainers: CLNT +35%. ZNGA +10%.
    Losers: HDSN -32%. ACHN -20%. LINE -11%. LNCO -10%. FMS -9%. LDK -7%. DVA -7%. BRY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM

  • Stocks in Thailand (THD) come off a three-day weekend up close to 1% as optimism grows over the...

    Stocks in Thailand (THD) come off a three-day weekend up close to 1% as optimism grows over the return of foreign capital.
